channel.title: How do you check if a file exist in java?
channel.description: I know how to check if a file exist like [code]File f = new File("dir")[/code] and so on, but the problem is, what if it was in C:\Users\?. How would I get there name the C:\Users\Name location is different for everyone, so how would i get there name for the location?

item.title: How do you check if a file exist in java?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

You can use Java 7â€™s NIO2 to do this easily.

Path directory = Paths.get(System.getProperty("user.home"));
if (Files.exists(directory)) {
    // whatever, i do i want
}

There is a plethora of functionality in the new NIO2 file package, check them out here.

EDIT 2: oh i guess i misread OP, lol damn these early mornings
